DOC.brief_summary: Quadricipital electrical stimulation add respiratory rehabilitation COPD patient . Quadricipital electrical stimulation ( ES ) chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) patient demonstrate improve dyspnea physical status . The aim study demonstrate ES add respiratory rehabilitation program induces great improvement exercise tolerance patient . Design : 160 patient severe COPD randomly assign 2 group : either rehabilitation program ( group 1 ) , either ES rehabilitation program ( group 2 ) . In group , rehabilitation program comprise endurance training , 18 - 24 session ( 6 - 8 week ) , health education , global muscular strengthen . In group 2 , bilateral quadricipital electrical stimulation 30 min session add 5 day / week . Subjects : COPD patient FEV1 < 50 % pred , FEV1/VC < 70 % , TLC > 80 % , dyspnea , stable condition , 18 > BMI < 35 kg/m² . Intervention : 6 min walk distance , incremental exercise test data ( aerobic capacity , work rate , ventilatory threshold ) , physical activity activity monitor , health relate quality life determine training . Abbreviations : FEV1 = force expiratory volume 1 sec ; VC = vital capacity ; TLC = total lung capacity ; BMI = body mass index .
